metadata.documentation: This dataset is formed by a reduced number of predictors (both at surface and at pressure levels) commonly used for Statistical Downscaling (SD). This information has been prepared by the Santander MetGroup as part of the work done in the statistical downscaling portal (http://www.meteo.unican.es/downscaling), and is distributed in the framework of different international initiatives (such as CORDEX-ESD and VALUE) in order to have a standard predictor dataset and to facilitate the work of the contributing downscaling groups. The Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) conducted JRA-55, the second Japanese global atmospheric reanalysis project. It covers 55 years, extending back to 1958, coinciding with the establishment of the global radiosonde observing system. Compared to its predecessor, JRA-25, JRA-55 is based on a new data assimilation and prediction system (DA) that improves many deficiencies found in the first Japanese reanalysis.
Data downloaded from http://rda.ucar.edu/data/ds628.0/ on 15/06/2015 and stored in the User Data Gateway (UDG) of the Santander MetGroup climate services (http://meteo.unican.es/en/dataservices).
Dataset included in the User Data Gateway (UDG, http://www.meteo.unican.es/udg-wiki) maintained by the Santander MetGroup. Register and accept the data policy to access to this dataset.
